references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces the ResNet architecture, a foundational model used extensively in visual reprogramming tasks and is directly relevant to the presented work.

references.paper_title: Learning multiple layers of features from tiny images
references.reason: This paper introduces the CIFAR-10/100 datasets, which are frequently used benchmarks for evaluating visual reprogramming techniques and are used in the experiments.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a vision-language model that is used in the experiments and is relevant to the discussion of vision-language models.
This paper introduces the concept of adversarial reprogramming, which is closely related to visual reprogramming and provides foundational context for the current work.

references.paper_title: Understanding and improving visual prompting: A label-mapping perspective
references.reason: This paper focuses on label mapping in visual prompting, a closely related technique to visual reprogramming, and directly compares with the proposed BLM method.
